channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: One shot of coronavirus vaccine likely won't be enoughâ€¯
item.description: When a coronavirus vaccine comes on the market, people will likely need two doses, not just one -- and that could cause real problems.

item.title: India struggles to contain its growing Covid-19 cases
item.description: The number of new coronavirus cases in India continues to skyrocket. CNN's Michael Holmes reports even though states are ramping up testing, getting the epidemic under control is easier said than done.

item.title: Elites are flouting coronavirus restrictions -- and that could hurt us all
Trump continues to break the polling
New York Times: Justice Department secretly curtailed investigation into Trump's Russia ties
item.description: The US Justice Department in 2017 took secret steps to curtail the special counsel investigation into Russian election interference and possible coordination with the Trump campaign, former law enforcement officials told The New York Times.

item.title: Night of deadly violence yields pointed leader responses
item.description: After a night of deadly protest violence in Portland, Oregon, officials responded in starkly different ways. CNN's Wolf Blitzer has the latest from Mayor Ted Wheeler, President Donald Trump and Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden.

item.title: Portland mayor to Trump: 'It's you who have created the hate'
White House says Trump still planning to visit Kenosha after governor urges him to reconsider
item.description: President Donald Trump is still planning to visit Kenosha, Wisconsin, this week after Democratic Wisconsin Gov. Tony Evers wrote him a letter urging that he reconsider as the city continues to grapple with racial unrest following the police shooting of Jacob Blake.

item.title: Axios: Trump offered FBI director job to John Kelly if he pledged loyalty
item.description: President Donald Trump offered then-Homeland Security secretary John Kelly the position of FBI director one day after he fired James Comey in 2017, but demanded that he be loyal, according to an Axios report citing New York Times reporter Michael Schmidt's forthcoming book.

item.title: MTV VMAs 2020: Lady Gaga, The Weeknd and more take home awards
item.description: The 2020 MTV Video Music Awards aired Sunday night and despite the Covid-19 pandemic, some of the biggest names in music showed up to accept their awards.

item.title: Operation Warp Speed officials cannot see coronavirus vaccine data early, official says
Evidence suggests an animal that roamed with the dinosaurs went into a hibernation-like state to survive
item.description: New evidence suggests the Lystrosaurus species that roamed the Earth with the dinosaurs went into a state of hibernation to survive what is modern day Antarctica.

item.title: CNN reporter pushes GOP senator on violence in Wisconsin
item.description: CNN's Dana Bash speaks to Sen. Ron Johnson (R-WI) about the violence that flared in Kenosha, Wisconsin, following the police shooting of Jacob Blake. Kyle Rittenhouse, 17, is accused of shooting and killing two men and injuring a third Tuesday night.

item.title: Major internet outage: Dozens of websites and apps were down
item.description: Cloudflare, an internet service that is supposed to keep websites up and running, was down itself Sunday, taking dozens of websites and online services along with it.

item.title: Twitter removes QAnon supporter's false claim about coronavirus death statistics that Trump had retweeted
item.description: Twitter on Sunday took down a tweet containing a false claim about coronavirus death statistics that was made by a supporter of the baseless QAnon conspiracy theory -- a post that President Donald Trump had retweeted earlier in the day.

item.title: Jerry Falwell Jr.'s fall from grace
item.description: Last fall, as scrutiny of his leadership of Liberty University began to intensify, Jerry Falwell Jr. revealed to a CNN reporter one of the secrets of his school's success.

item.title: Expert compares Trump's politics to fascism
item.description: Yale philosophy professor Jason Stanley explains why he claims President Donald Trump's politics are akin to fascism, a political movement based around a leader.

item.title: 2 Russian aircraft make 'unsafe' intercept of US Air Force B-52 bomber
item.description: Two Russian aircraft made an "unsafe, unprofessional" intercept of a US Air Force B-52 bomber on Friday over the Black Sea and in international waters, according to a statement from US Air Forces in Europe and Air Forces Africa Public Affairs.

item.title: Lewis Hamilton pays tribute to Chadwick Boseman after Belgian GP victory
item.description: Lewis Hamilton paid his own tribute to Chadwick Boseman after closing to within two wins of Michael Schumacher's all-time Formula One record by claiming the Belgian Grand Prix on Sunday.

item.title: Here's what it's like to fact-check Trump leading up to the election
item.description: Daniel Dale is working hard to fact-check Trump, which is becoming increasingly important as the 2020 election approaches.

item.title: Video shows forceful arrest of Black man stopped while jogging
item.description: A Black man in San Antonio, Texas, was stopped and detained by police while he was jogging, witnesses said, as officers searched for a suspect in a nearby domestic violence call. CNN affiliate KSAT reports.

item.title: Lionel Messi skips mandatory coronavirus test at Barcelona
item.description: Lionel Messi failed to show up for a coronavirus test at Barcelona's training ground on Sunday, club sources have confirmed to CNN, casting further doubt on his future at the La Liga powerhouse.

item.title: The crazy-but-true story of a WWII fighter pilot who said his artificial legs saved his life
This couple has the best office view in the world
item.description: Margrit and Joe Fahan were Delta Airline pilots for 30 years. They documented their farewell water salute at JFK, rescue pet flights and other up-in-the-air moments for their 15,000 (and counting) Instagram followers

item.title: Putin passes on 'warm wishes' to embattled Lukashenko, as tanks are seen in Minsk amid protests
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has sent his "warm wishes" to his embattled Belarusian counterpart Alexander Lukashenko on Sunday, as thousands of anti-government protesters attended a rally in Minsk and a convoy of military tanks was seen in the city.

item.title: French uproar over magazine's portrayal of Black politician as slave
item.description: A French right-wing magazine has sparked outrage over an illustration published in its most recent issue depicting the Black politician DaniÃ¨le Obono as an 18th century slave.

item.title: Hurricane Laura was so strong it pushed the Mississippi River backwards
item.description: Strong winds from Hurricane Laura caused surface water on the Mississippi River to change direction.

item.title: A 1-year-old is back with his mom after being abducted from his stroller at gunpoint
item.description: A one-year-old boy is safe and back at home with his mother after being abducted from his stroller at gunpoint Saturday, authorities said.

item.title: Twitter's most liked tweet of all time now belongs to Chadwick Boseman
item.description: The tweet announcing that the world had lost Chadwick Boseman is now the most liked tweet of all time.

item.title: Then and now: 57 years, two Washington marches, one call to end racism
item.description: On the 57th anniversary of Martin Luther King's "I have a dream" speech, people from all over the United States descended on the nation's capital once again to demand justice.

item.title: Japanese company is first to successfully test a flying car with a driver
item.description: A Japanese company has announced the successful test drive of a flying car.

item.title: As the US Open is set to begin, a player won't compete after a positive coronavirus test
item.description: A US Open player won't compete in the event after testing positive for the coronavirus, the United States Tennis Association said Sunday.

item.title: Cruise trips are back. This is what they look like now
item.description: Boarding in the Italian port of Genoa for a seven-day Mediterranean cruise on August 16, travel agent Valeria Belardi prepared herself for a voyage like no other.

item.title: 10-year-old challenges rock legend Dave Grohl to drum battle
item.description: Prodigious drummer Nandi Bushell loves the Foo Fighters and the band's frontman accepted her online challenge.

item.title: Great-grandmother beats coronavirus after five months in hospital and rehab
item.description: Marie Delus had not touched her mother since she took her to a New York City emergency room in March.

item.title: VR lets you experience racism in the workplace
item.description: If you were at work and one of your colleagues made a racist remark, would you challenge it or let it pass?

item.title: Beautiful but deadly weed is being used to clean up oil spills
item.description: With its succulent leaves and violet flowers, water hyacinth may look beautiful, but it is in fact deadly.

item.title: Reporter has close call with blast of electricity live on air
item.description: Hurricane Laura pushes around reporters covering the storm. CNN's Jeanne Moos has the wettest, wildest reporter moments.

item.title: Netflix series explores an overload side of plastic surgery
item.description: For vanity or medical necessity? To enhance or to correct? Clients or patients? Plastic surgery has traditionally been divided into two separate camps: the cosmetic and the reconstructive.

item.title: Eastern Europe's hidden holiday paradise
item.description: For more than a century, Bulgaria has had little trouble enticing people to its beach resorts scattered along the Black Sea coast. City-breakers head to its main cities -- including Sofia, the capital, and Plovdiv, the 2019 European Capital of Culture -- for an enjoyable blend of culture and hearty Bulgarian gastronomy.

item.title: VMAs 2020: How to watch, performances and nominations
item.description: Sunday's MTV Video Music Awards will be unlike the any of the event's previous shows.

item.title: CNN.com is 25 years old today
item.description: On August 30, 1995, CNN set up a new website, CNN Interactive. The website, now called CNN.com, served as a major transformation in how CNN delivered news: Instead of one story at a time on TV, CNN delivered hundreds, and then thousands of stories to users on its website.

item.title: These businesses are faring well with Americans stuck at home
item.description: Although the pandemic brought about one of the steepest economic contractions in history, home improvement businesses have fared well through the downturn.

item.title: How elites ruined the fight against coronavirus
item.description: When countries impose restrictions to combat coronavirus, there's an implicit pact between the government and people: we're all in this together.

item.title: Florida reports 2,500 new Covid-19 cases
Trump crowd is asked to wear masks. Watch what happened
item.description: Before President Trump's speech in New Hampshire, the crowd booed an announcement at the event asking the attendees to wear masks.

item.title: Trump continues to break the polling
item.description: â€¢ Trump can still win this election â€¢ Analysis: Forget the 2020 election. Let's talk 2024

item.title: Portland mayor excoriates Trump: 'It's you who have created the hate'
How Shinzo Abe's exit could threaten regional stability and Japan's alliance with the US
item.description: Rumors concerning Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's health had circulated for weeks, and while his resignation on Friday could not have come as a complete shock to United States officials, the timing of the announcement is worrisome.

item.title: New Zealand spy agency investigating 'severe' cyberattack on stock exchange
item.description: New Zealand has ordered one of its spy agencies to investigate a cyberattack that originated overseas and disrupted the country's financial markets for a fourth consecutive day on Friday.
